Error.backHome: Take me back to home page

Index.delete-account-info: If you delete your account, all your data will be irretrievably deleted.
Index.title: Time tracking with
Index.edutime_introduction: With EduTime, teachers can precisely and comprehensively document their working hours according to the various categories of their professional duties. The statistics function provides an overview of the hours worked in the individual areas of professional duties. This statistic can be exported for proof of hours worked or for further analysis. EduTime helps teachers to efficiently plan and document their working time.
Index.contact-subtitle: Do you have questions or suggestions? We look forward to your message.
Index.privacy-statement: All data is stored locally on your device, without requiring an internet connection. No data is exchanged with a server. The responsibility for securing and protecting the data lies with the user.

Privacy.title: EduTime Privacy Policy
Privacy.sections_inhalt_content:
With this privacy policy, we inform you about the personal data (data that can directly or indirectly identify you) we collect and process in connection with our activities. It applies to all processing activities related to personal data. We handle the received and collected data responsibly, in accordance with applicable legal provisions and this privacy policy. Our processing is primarily governed by the Swiss Data Protection Act (DSG).

If we consider it useful, we may provide you with additional privacy policies or other legal documents (e.g., terms and conditions, usage and participation conditions) for specific or additional processing activities.
Privacy.sections_wer-ist-verantwortlich_content:
The responsible party for the processing of your personal data as described in this privacy policy, unless otherwise specified in individual cases, is the data controller under the Data Protection Act:

EduTime GmbH
c/o Tim Ogi
Bienenstrasse 8
3018 Bern

References to 'EduTime', 'we', or 'us' in this privacy policy are references to the aforementioned data controller. If you have a data protection concern, you can contact us at any time, particularly at the following email address:

privacy@edutime.ch (Subject: 'Data Protection').
Privacy.sections_welche-personendaten-bearbeiten: 3. What personal data do we process?

We collect and process the following personal data from you:

[ul][li]Master data, such as name, address, email address, phone number, gender, date of birth, social media profiles, photos, videos, relationship information (customer, service provider, etc.), history, official information (e.g., commercial register extracts, permits, etc.), information on subscribed newsletters or other advertising (including consents);[liend][li]Communication data, such as contact details, communication methods (phone, email, text messages, video messages, etc.), and the location, date, time, and content of the communication;[liend][li]Registration data, such as username, password, email address;[liend][li]Financial data, such as payment information, credit information;[liend][li]Contract data, data related to contract conclusion or contract processing, such as information on contract conclusion, acquired rights and claims, customer satisfaction information, purchase information (e.g., purchase date, location, time, history, and quantity, type, and value of goods/services);[liend][li]Technical data, such as IP address, operating system, date, time, geographic information;[liend][li]Behavioral data, such as the duration and frequency of visits to our website or app, the date and time of a visit or opening a message (newsletter, email, etc.), the location of your device, interaction with our online presences on social networks or other third-party platforms;[liend][li]Preference data, such as user settings, data from the analysis of collected data (especially behavioral data);[liend][li]Other data that you provide to us about yourself.[liend][ulend]
Privacy.sections_wie-erheben-wir-personendaten_t: 4. How do we collect personal data?
Privacy.sections_wie-erheben-wir-personendaten_c: We collect your personal data in various ways. On the one hand, we collect the personal data that you provide to us (e.g., via email, phone, postal mail, registration), that we receive from third parties (e.g., from business partners, authorities), and that we collect about you (e.g., from publicly accessible registers, websites, business partners).
Privacy.sections_ueberlassene-daten_content:
You provide us with your personal data when you interact with us, such as in the following circumstances:

[ul][li]When you communicate with us or our employees;[liend][li]When you create a user account with us;[liend][li]When you visit our business premises;[liend][li]When you attend our customer events and public events;[liend][li]When you purchase our products or services (e.g., online);[liend][li]When you register to use certain offers and services (e.g., apps, newsletters, free Wi-Fi);[liend][li]When you participate in one of our competitions or sweepstakes.[liend][ulend]
The provided data primarily includes master, communication, registration, and contract data, but also preference data.

In general, the provision of personal data is voluntary, meaning that you are not usually required to provide us with personal data. However, we must collect and process the personal data necessary for the processing of a contractual relationship and the fulfillment of associated obligations or as required by law, such as mandatory master and contract data. Otherwise, we may not be able to conclude or continue the respective contract.

If you provide us with data about other people (e.g., family members, employees), we assume that you are authorized to do so and that the data is accurate. Please ensure that these other individuals are informed about this privacy policy.

If you do not provide certain personal data, it may result in the inability to provide the associated service or conclude a contract. We will generally inform you where the provision of personal data is mandatory.
Privacy.sections_erhaltene-daten_content:
We may also receive personal data about you from third parties, such as the following:

[ul][li]From business partners with whom we cooperate, such as banks, insurance companies, distributors, and other contractual partners (especially organizations like schools);[liend][li]From individuals who communicate with us;[liend][li]From credit agencies, e.g., when we obtain credit information;[liend][li]From address traders or the Swiss Post, e.g., for address updates;[liend][li]From online service providers, e.g., internet analytics services;[liend][li]From authorities and courts in connection with administrative and judicial proceedings.[liend][ulend]
The received data primarily includes master, communication, financial, and contract data, but also preference data.
Privacy.sections_erhobene-daten_content:
We may also collect your personal data ourselves or automatically, such as in the following circumstances:

[ul][li]When you use our services;[liend][li]When you make use of our services;[liend][li]When you place orders and/or make purchases with us;[liend][li]When you visit our websites or use our apps;[liend][li]When we consult publicly accessible sources (e.g., public registers, websites, platforms);[liend][li]When we obtain information about you from your organization or another organization or company (e.g., for reference purposes during the application process, if you consent);[liend][li]When we work with business partners;[liend][li]When you click on a link in one of our newsletters or otherwise interact with one of our electronic marketing communications.[liend][ulend]
The collected data primarily includes behavioral data and technical data.

We may also derive further personal data from already existing personal data, for example, by evaluating behavioral data. Frequently, such derived personal data includes preference data.
Privacy.sections_fuer-welche-zwecke-bearbeiten-w: 5. For what purposes do we process personal data?

We primarily process your personal data to conclude and manage our contracts with you, our customers, and our business partners. We also process your personal data for the following purposes:

[ul][li]to communicate with you;[liend][li]to provide and improve our services (including websites) to you and our customers;[liend][li]to manage the business relationship with you and our customers;[liend][li]to conduct advertising, marketing, market research, and product development;[liend][li]to ensure your and our security and prevent abuse (e.g., for IT security, theft, fraud, and abuse prevention, and for evidence purposes);[liend][li]to comply with legal obligations;[liend][li]to enforce our claims and defend ourselves against claims from others;[liend][li]to prepare and execute the sale or purchase of business areas, companies, or parts of companies and other corporate transactions, including the transfer of personal data;[liend][li]for business management.[liend][ulend]
When processing personal data for the purposes described in this policy, we rely, among other things, on our legitimate interest in maintaining, expanding, and managing the business relationship and communication with you as a business partner regarding our products and services.

For certain purposes, you may grant us your consent to process your personal data. To the extent that we have no other legal basis, we process your personal data within the scope of and based on this consent. You may revoke your consent at any time. A revocation does not affect processing that has already taken place.
Privacy.sections_warum-und-wie-teilen-wir-daten_: 6. Why and how do we share data?

We may share your personal data with trusted third parties as necessary or useful for the provision of our services or to fulfill the purposes defined in this privacy policy. We may share your personal data with the following categories of recipients: external service providers (e.g., IT service providers, auditors, shipping companies, payment services); customers and other contractual partners; counterparties, their legal representatives, and involved persons; business partners with whom we may need to coordinate the provision of services; authorities and courts. Please note that these recipients may, in turn, engage third parties, so your data may also be accessible to them.

If we share your personal data with third parties who process your personal data on our behalf, this is done based on our instructions and in accordance with our privacy policy and other appropriate confidentiality and security measures. For example, we use service providers to support the operation of our IT infrastructure, provide our products and services, improve our internal business processes, and offer additional support to our customers.

We generally process your personal data only in Switzerland and the European Economic Area (EEA) (see also below Section 6). On our websites and apps, we use services from third-party providers; please refer to our cookie policy (below Section 13) for information on data collection by these third-party providers.
Privacy.sections_warum-und-wie-geben-wir-daten-i: 7. Why and how do we transfer data abroad?

We may transfer your personal data to recipients in the European Economic Area (EEA), as well as to recipients in the USA and other countries that do not provide a level of data protection comparable to Swiss law (so-called third countries). We typically do this when it is necessary to fulfill a contract or enforce legal claims. If we transfer data to other third countries that you are not already aware of (e.g., from the contract or communication with us), the respective country, international organization, or at least the region will generally be indicated in this privacy policy and specifically in the cookie policy. We only transfer your personal data to a third country if the legal requirements for data protection are met (e.g., after concluding recognized standard data protection clauses, according to the Swiss-U.S. Data Privacy Framework, or obtaining consent) or if we can rely on an exception. An exception may apply in cases of overriding public interest or when the processing of a contract that is in your interest requires such disclosure.
Privacy.sections_wie-setzen-wir-profiling-ein_co: Profiling refers to the automated processing of personal data to analyze or make predictions about personal aspects (e.g., analyzing personal interests and habits). Profiling generally derives preference data. We use profiling primarily in the automated processing of master, contract, behavioral, and preference data when using and purchasing our offers and services, but also in connection with our websites, apps, events, competitions, and sweepstakes. We use profiling primarily to improve our offers, present these and our content according to your needs, present you with only the advertisements and offers that are likely relevant to you, and decide which payment options are available to you based on a credit check. We may also link personal data from different sources to improve the quality of our analyses and predictions.
Privacy.sections_wie-treffen-wir-automatisierte-: 9. How do we make automated individual decisions?

Automated individual decisions are decisions made fully automatically, i.e., without human involvement, which may have legal consequences for the individual concerned or otherwise significantly affect them. We generally do not use automated individual decisions, but if we do, we will inform you separately in individual cases.
Privacy.sections_wie-schuetzen-wir-daten_content: We take appropriate technical (e.g., firewall, SSL encryption, password protection) and organizational (e.g., access restriction, training of authorized personnel) security measures to ensure the security of your personal data. These measures protect your personal data against unauthorized or unlawful processing, access, and/or against accidental loss, alteration, or disclosure. Please always keep in mind that transmitting information over the internet and other electronic means carries certain security risks. We cannot guarantee the security of information transmitted in this way.
Privacy.sections_wie-lange-bewahren-wir-daten-au: 11. How long do we retain data?

We retain your personal data as long as necessary for our processing purposes (see Section 4), legal retention periods (typically five or ten years), and our legitimate interests, especially for documentation and evidence purposes, require or technical reasons make storage necessary (e.g., in the case of backups or document management systems). We delete or anonymize your personal data, provided there are no legal or contractual obligations or technical reasons preventing this, generally after the expiration of the storage and processing period as part of our usual procedures and in accordance with our retention policy.
Privacy.sections_cookie-richtlinie_content: Below, we describe how and for what purposes we use log data, cookies, similar technologies, and other third-party services when using our websites and apps (collectively referred to as 'website') and thereby process personal and other data.
Privacy.sections_was-sind-log-daten_content: Certain information is automatically logged and stored whenever a web server is connected for technical reasons. When you visit our website, information is automatically sent to the server of our website. This information includes the IP address of your computer, the date and time of access, the name and URL of the retrieved data, the website from which access was made (referrer URL), the browser type and version, and other information transmitted by the browser (e.g., operating system of your computer, geographic location, language setting). This information is temporarily stored in a so-called log file and retained in accordance with legal requirements. We process this data for the purpose of ensuring a smooth connection setup and a comfortable use of our website, as well as for evaluating system security and stability.
Privacy.sections_was-sind-cookies-und-aehnliche-: 12.2 What are cookies and similar technologies?

We may use cookies and similar technologies on our website. Cookies are typically small text files that your browser automatically creates and stores on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone, etc.) when you access our site. Session cookies store your inputs while you navigate from page to page within the website. Session cookies are deleted after a short period, at the latest when you close your browser. Persistent cookies remain stored even after the browser is closed for a specific period. Similar technologies include, for example, pixel tags (invisible images or a program code that are loaded from a server and transmit specific information to the server operator), fingerprints (information about the device and browser collected when visiting a website and distinguishing the device from others), and other technologies (e.g., 'web storage') for storing data in the browser.

We use both persistent and session cookies on our website. We may not always be able to identify you with a cookie. We use cookies and similar technologies to statistically capture the use of our website and evaluate it for optimization and user-friendliness purposes. We also use cookies for the purpose of providing our services (especially technically necessary cookies). Cookies have different retention periods. We have no control over the retention periods of cookies set by third parties.
Privacy.sections_wie-koennen-sie-cookies-und-aeh: 12.3 How can you disable cookies and similar technologies?

You can configure your browser not to automatically accept cookies and similar technologies or to delete existing cookies and other data stored in the browser. You can also extend your browser with additional software (so-called 'add-ons' or 'plug-ins') that prevent tracking by certain third parties (such plug-ins are available, for example, at www.noscript.net or www.ghostery.com). You can usually find more information in your browser's help pages under the keyword 'privacy'. Please note that partial or complete deactivation of cookies may result in you not being able to use all the functions of our websites.
Privacy.sections_welche-cookies-und-aehnliche-te: 12.4 What cookies and similar technologies do we use and how do we use them?

Technically necessary cookies: We use persistent cookies to save your personal user settings (especially concerning cookies and language selection on our website). We do not process any personal data from you in this process. The purpose of the processing is to re-identify your personal settings on our website. These cookies are necessary for the functionality of our website. These cookies are automatically deleted from your system after a maximum of one month. You can also delete the cookies manually at any time. Please note that your user settings will be lost.
Privacy.sections_technisch-notwendige-cookies_co: We use persistent cookies to save your personal user settings (especially concerning cookies and language selection on our website). We do not process any personal data from you in this process. The purpose of the processing is to re-identify your personal settings on our website. These cookies are necessary for the functionality of our website. These cookies are automatically deleted from your system after a maximum of one month. You can also delete the cookies manually at any time. Please note that your user settings will be lost.
Privacy.sections_erfolgs-und-reichweitenmessung_:
We use the following services for success and reach measurement:

[ul][li]Supabase by Supabase, Inc., based at 970 Toa Payoh North #07-04, Singapore 318992. This service monitors and records the way our app's authentication service is used. Supabase provides us with the collected information in aggregated form. We cannot identify individual visitors. Data transfer is based on the EU Commission's standard contractual clauses with adjustments for Swiss law. Details can be found at: https://supabase.com/legal/dpa. Supabase may use the data it additionally collects and the insights gained from it for its own purposes. Supabase then processes your personal data under its own responsibility and according to its privacy policy. More information regarding the collected data can be found in Supabase's privacy policy at: https://supabase.com/privacy.[liend][li]Plausible Analytics by Plausible Insights OÜ, Västriku tn 2, 50403, Tartu, Estonia. We use Plausible Analytics for privacy-friendly analysis of our website usage. Plausible completely avoids cookies and does not store any personal data. The collected information is aggregated and does not allow identification of individual visitors. Data processing takes place exclusively within the EU. More information can be found at: https://plausible.io/data-policy[liend][ulend]
Privacy.sections_bot-erkennung-und-blockierung_c:
We use the following services to identify and block bots:

[ul][li]Cloudflare Bot Manager by Cloudflare, Inc., 101 Townsend Street, San Francisco, California 94107, USA. We use Cloudflare Bot Manager to protect our website from harmful bots. The set cookie is deleted after 30 minutes. More information can be found at: https://developers.cloudflare.com/fundamentals/reference/policies-compliances/cloudflare-cookies/#__cf_bm-cookie-for-cloudflare-bot-products. Cloudflare participates in the US Department of Commerce's self-certification process and complies with the principles of the Swiss-U.S. Data Privacy Framework when processing personal data from Switzerland. Cloudflare's privacy policy can be found at: https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/[liend][ulend]
Privacy.sections_dienste-von-drittanbieter_conte:
We use third-party services to provide you with our website and offer additional features. In particular, we use the following services:

[ul][li]Supabase by Supabase, Inc., 970 Toa Payoh North #07-04, Singapore 318992. We use Supabase to store and process our website and data (especially database) so that we can deliver content and data quickly and flawlessly on all devices. The processing of personal data takes place in the EU (server location Frankfurt, DE). If personal data is transferred to an insecure third country, this data transfer is based on the EU Commission's standard contractual clauses with adjustments for Swiss law. Details can be found at: https://supabase.com/legal/dpa. Supabase's privacy policy can be found at: https://supabase.com/privacy;[liend][li]Cloudflare by Cloudflare, Inc., 101 Townsend Street, San Francisco, California 94107, USA. We use Cloudflare to deliver our website content quickly and flawlessly on all devices. Cloudflare participates in the US Department of Commerce's self-certification process and complies with the principles of the Swiss-U.S. Data Privacy Framework when processing personal data from Switzerland. Cloudflare's privacy policy can be found at: https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/;[liend][li]DigitalOcean, LLC, 101 6th Ave New York, NY 10013, USA. We use DigitalOcean to deliver our website content quickly and flawlessly on all devices (especially hosting and web server). The processing of personal data takes place in the EU (server location Frankfurt, DE). DigitalOcean participates in the US Department of Commerce's self-certification process and complies with the principles of the Swiss-U.S. Data Privacy Framework when processing personal data from Switzerland. DigitalOcean's privacy policy can be found at: https://www.digitalocean.com/legal/privacy-policy;[liend][li]Plausible Analytics by Plausible Insights OÜ, Västriku tn 2, 50403, Tartu, Estonia. We use Plausible Analytics for website analysis and optimization. The service works without cookies and does not collect any personal data. Processing takes place entirely within the EU. More information can be found at: https://plausible.io/privacy;[liend][ulend]
Privacy.sections_welche-rechte-haben-sie_content:
As a potentially affected person, you may assert various claims against us in accordance with the applicable national and international provisions. We may process your personal data again to fulfill your claims.

You have the following rights regarding your personal data:

[ul][li]Right to information: You have the right to receive information about the personal data we have about you and how we process it;[liend][li]Right to data release or transfer: You have the right to receive or transfer a copy of your personal data in a common electronic format, provided it is processed automatically and the data is processed based on your consent or in direct connection with the conclusion or fulfillment of a contract between you and us;[liend][li]Right to rectification: You have the right to have your personal data corrected if it is inaccurate;[liend][li]Right to erasure: You have the right to have your personal data erased;[liend][li]Right to object: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data (especially when processing for direct marketing purposes).[liend][ulend]
Please note that these rights are subject to conditions and exceptions. We may restrict or deny your request to exercise these rights if legally permissible. We reserve the right to redact or provide copies only in part for data protection or confidentiality reasons.

If you wish to exercise your rights with respect to us or are not satisfied with how we handle your rights or privacy, please contact us; our contact details are in Section 1. To prevent misuse, we must identify you (e.g., with a copy of your ID, if necessary).
Privacy.sections_rechtsgrundlagen-nach-dsgvo_con:
We do not assume that the EU General Data Protection Regulation ('GDPR') applies in our case. However, if this is exceptionally different for certain data processing activities, then this Section 15 applies exclusively for the purposes of the GDPR and the data processing activities subject to it.

We base the processing of your personal data particularly on the following grounds:

[ul][li]it is necessary as described in Section 4 for the initiation and conclusion of contracts and their management and enforcement (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR);[liend][li]it is necessary to safeguard our legitimate interests or those of third parties as described in Section 4, namely for communication with you or third parties, to operate our website, to improve our electronic offerings and register for certain offers and services, for security purposes, to comply with Swiss law and internal regulations for our risk management and corporate governance, and for other purposes such as training and education, administration, evidence and quality assurance, organization, implementation and follow-up of events, and to safeguard other legitimate interests (see Section 4) (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR);[liend][li]it is legally required or permitted due to our mandate or position under the law of the EEA or a member state (Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR) or necessary to protect your vital interests or those of other natural persons (Art. 6(1)(d) GDPR);[liend][li]you have given your consent to the processing, e.g., via a corresponding declaration on our website (Art. 6(1)(a) and Art. 9(2)(a) GDPR).[liend][ulend]
If you are in the EEA, in addition to the rights in Section 14, you also have the right to restrict data processing, and you can complain to the data protection supervisory authority in your country. A list of authorities in the EEA can be found here: https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/board/members_en
Privacy.sections_wie-koennen-wir-diese-datenschu: 15. How can we change this privacy policy?

We may change this privacy policy at any time or initiate new processing activities. We also update this privacy policy from time to time to reflect legal requirements. We will inform you of such changes and additions in an appropriate manner, particularly by publishing the current privacy policy on our website (see below). The current privacy policy can be accessed at any time at https://edutime.ch/privacy.

Terms.scopeContent: These terms and conditions (T&C) govern the contractual relationship between EduTime, UID: CHE-459.271.466, (hereinafter "provider") and the organizations that provide seats for the use of the online time tracking app for teachers (hereinafter "app"). They also govern the use of the app by registered users within these organizations.
Terms.subjectMatterContent: The provider offers an online app that allows teachers to record and manage their working hours. The use of the app is exclusively based on these T&C.
Terms.forOrganizationsContent: 1. The contract between the provider and the organization is concluded as soon as the organization pays the corresponding subscription fees and accepts the T&C. 2. The organization then receives access to an administration area where it can manage seats for the teachers.
Terms.forUsersContent: 1. To use the app, teachers must register. Registration can be done at any time by the users themselves. 2. After registration, the seats must be assigned to the users by the organization.
Terms.descriptionOfServicesContent: 1. The app allows teachers to digitally record their working hours. 2. In principle, no data can be exchanged between users of the app. 3. The provider makes the app available in the current version and strives to develop and improve the app.
Terms.dutiesOrganizationsContent: a) Organizations: 1. The organization undertakes to pay the subscription fees on time. 2. The organization is responsible for ensuring that its members use the app in accordance with applicable laws and these T&C. 3. The organization may not sell the seats.
Terms.dutiesUsersContent: b) Users: 1. The user undertakes to use the app only in accordance with applicable laws and these T&C. 2. The user must not upload any data or content that infringes the rights of third parties or is illegal.
Terms.liabilityContent: 1. The provider is only liable for damages caused by intentional or grossly negligent acts of the provider. 2. The provider assumes no liability for the constant availability of the app. Even in the event of data loss, which is unlikely but possible, no liability can be assumed. However, the provider will make all reasonable efforts to restore the availability of the app as soon as possible. 3. Support is provided on a best-effort basis, which means that the provider will strive to process and resolve all inquiries and issues as quickly as possible, without guaranteeing a specific response time or a complete solution.
Terms.dataProtectionContent: The protection of users' personal data is a top priority for the provider. Details on data processing are contained in the privacy policy.
Terms.durationOrganizationsContent: a) For Organizations: 1. The contract is concluded for an indefinite period. 2. The organization can terminate the contract at any time with four weeks' notice at the end of the respective billing period. The provider reserves the right to terminate the contract with four weeks' notice.
Terms.durationUsersContent: b) For Users: 1. The user can delete their account at any time. This does not automatically terminate the contract between the organization and the provider.
Terms.finalProvisionsContent: 1. If any provisions of these T&C are invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall not be affected. 2. Swiss law applies, unless it is overridden by mandatory national laws.

UserGuide.registration-text: Welcome to EduTime, your platform for efficient time tracking. Register to use the specially designed solution for educational institutions that enables effective management and monitoring of working hours. Enter your email address and a password. After registration, you must confirm your email address before you can log in for the first time. First and last name are optional. Please select the canton where you work. If your canton is not yet available, use an alternative canton for now and update the details once your canton becomes available.
UserGuide.seat-text: A 'seat' in EduTime entitles you to use it and is assigned by your organization or school. Contact your institution to gain access.
UserGuide.migration-text: If you previously saved data in our old app, it can be easily transferred to the new environment. To do this, open the old app and navigate to 'Dashboard' via the yellow button at the bottom left, then select 'Statistics and Data' and 'Export Raw Data'. You can save the data directly on your smartphone if you want to perform the process on your phone, or you can email the file to yourself to continue the process on a computer. In the new web app, go to 'Settings' -> 'Import Data' -> 'Start Import'. Select the .csv file you exported. You can see which entries will be created and have the option to deselect specific entries you do not want to import using checkboxes.
UserGuide.time-recording-text: In the time recording view, you can select the day for which you want to view or edit entries at the top. Use the arrows to jump a week forward or backward. Below is a table showing the days of the week for the selected day. Click on another day to change the date and view the time recording for that day. In this table, you also see the total recorded time for each day of the week.
UserGuide.time-recording-text2: The lower table lists the individual entries. Click on an entry to edit or delete it. Use the bottom left button to start the timer. Click this button again to manage the timer. Here you can capture additional information about the entry and create, save temporarily, discard, or create and immediately start a new entry (arrow to the right of the 'Create' button).
UserGuide.time-recording-create: Use the right 'Create Entry' button to create a new entry. Select a category and enter the start time, end time, and duration of the time element. In the comment, you can make notes about the corresponding element. The 'Repeat' function can be used to create an element multiple times. In the interval, specify on which days and until what time entries should be created. Use 'Select Days' to select or deselect additional days. Use the 'Create Entries' button to create the entries.
UserGuide.time-recording-further-categories: Additional settings captured in the settings are visible as categories and entries can be assigned to them.
UserGuide.school-year-text: Use the arrows and year inputs to select the desired school year. The table shows each day of the school year and the recorded time. Click on a day to edit it in the time recording function. On smaller screens, the months are abbreviated to their first letters, and on very small screens, the semesters are selected separately.

NewEduTime.title: EduTime Reinvented: Your Web Application for Efficient Time Tracking
NewEduTime.introduction: EduTime is new and improved! Previously available only as a smartphone app, it will now be accessible as a completely revamped web application starting Summer 2024.
NewEduTime.web-app-description: The EduTime web application now allows for seamless use on smartphones and computers, enabling you to access your time tracking data and statistics anytime, from any device.
NewEduTime.design-description: Based on your feedback, EduTime has been redesigned from the ground up to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly experience.
NewEduTime.app-description: In addition to the web application, a smartphone app is under development that can be installed directly on your mobile device, providing unrestricted access even on the go. The app is scheduled for release in 2025.
NewEduTime.data-transfer-description1: The old app will not be developed further. Transferring your data from the old app to the new web version is straightforward and is explained in detail in the

Features.title: Key Features
Features.timeTrackingDesc: Tracking by job order categories, data accessible on all devices.
Features.employmentConsiderationDesc: Define an employment and the statistics will adapt. You can also specify additional roles such as school management.
Features.statisticsDesc: Breakdown of all work, soon with reporting functionality.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.get-license-title: How do I get an EduTime license?
FAQ.get-license-text: Licenses for EduTime can only be obtained by organizations or schools. Education Bern currently offers these licenses, and members can use the app for free.
FAQ.use-on-phone-title: Can I use EduTime on my smartphone?
FAQ.use-on-phone-text: EduTime is a web app and can be used on any smartphone via a web browser. A native smartphone app is expected to be available in 2025.
FAQ.region-unavailable-title: My canton is not available, what can I do?
FAQ.region-unavailable-text: If your canton is not currently available, you can temporarily select another canton. Additional cantons will be added upon request. It is recommended to start with an available canton.
FAQ.transfer-data-title: Can I transfer my data from the old app?
FAQ.transfer-data-text: Yes, transferring your data from an older app is possible. More information can be found in the user manual.
FAQ.purchase-license-title: How can I purchase licenses for my school/educational organization?
FAQ.purchase-license-text: To purchase licenses for your school or educational organization, please contact us directly for more details.

EduTimeLicense.license-intro: Licenses for the use of EduTime can only be purchased by schools and other educational organizations. Each school or organization can centrally manage the licenses and assign them to their members, such as teachers. Individuals cannot purchase licenses directly; they must gain access through their respective school or organization.
EduTimeLicense.how-to-obtain-text: If your school or educational organization wishes to purchase EduTime licenses, please contact us directly. Provide us with the desired number of licenses and the email address(es) of the person(s) who will manage the licenses. For schools and organizations that wish to test the app first, we also offer a trial access. This trial access allows you to try EduTime without obligation before deciding to purchase.
EduTimeLicense.special-conditions-title: Special Conditions for Members of Bildung Bern
EduTimeLicense.special-conditions-text: Members of the educational organization Bildung Bern have the opportunity to obtain EduTime licenses directly through Bildung Bern. If you are a member, please contact Bildung Bern directly to request your licenses and gain access to the app.
EduTimeLicense.partner-organizations-text: EduTime collaborates with various schools and educational organizations to ensure seamless access to the app. A list of participating schools and organizations will be available here soon. This list will allow you to search for institutions that already manage licenses for EduTime and provide a quick overview of our partners.

Report.reportDescription: The time period selected in the statistics is used for the report. The report can be downloaded in PDF form and shared via email, for example.
Report.reportFooter: This report was generated with EduTime (edutime.ch).

Statistics.tgNoAnnualWorkTime: No annual working time is configured for your canton, therefore there is no target in the statistics.

Error.notFound: There is nothing to see here
Error.notFoundDescription: The page you want to open does not exist. You may have entered the address incorrectly, or the page has been moved to a different URL. If you think this is an error, please contact the support.

MobileApp.title: EduTime - Mobile App
MobileApp.heading: EduTime Mobile App
MobileApp.description: The EduTime Mobile App is now available! Download the app and use EduTime on the go with your smartphone.
MobileApp.android_instruction: Scan QR code or click below to view in Play Store
MobileApp.ios_instruction: Scan QR code or click below to view in App Store

DemoSection.title: Try EduTime
DemoSection.description: Test EduTime for free or share it with your school administration to purchase licenses for your school.
DemoSection.linkCopiedMessage: The link has been copied to your clipboard
DemoSection.emailBody:
Hello,

I would like to introduce you to EduTime - a time tracking app specifically for teachers.

EduTime enables teachers to track their working hours according to professional duty categories and offers comprehensive statistics features.

You can find more information and the option to purchase licenses here: https://edutime.ch

Best regards

Hello,

I am interested in {count} EduTime licenses.

Best regards

PriceCalculator.quoteFooter: This quote was generated with EduTime (edutime.ch). Prices in CHF, excl. VAT.
PriceCalculator.quoteContactForCustom: For more than 100 licenses, please contact us for a custom quote.

PricingOptions.description: EduTime offers flexible pricing models for individuals, schools, and organizations

AppPlatforms.description: Use EduTime on your computer, tablet, or smartphone - available everywhere and anytime.
AppPlatforms.webappDescription: Use EduTime directly in your browser. No installation required, works on all devices.
AppPlatforms.mobileDescription: Download the EduTime app for Android or iOS and use EduTime on the go.

PartnerOrganizations.description: EduTime works with various educational organizations. Here you can see a selection of our partners:

Pricing.demoSubtitle: Full access – no credit card required

NoLicense.description-admin: Manage the licenses of your organisation. If you also want to use EduTime for time tracking yourself, you can assign a license to yourself there.
NoLicense.demo-already-used-message: You have already used your demo trial. Please purchase a license to continue using EduTime.
NoLicense.purchase-description: Get an annual license for EduTime

TimeRecordingHero.feature2Description: Clear statistics on all hours worked

Contract.title: Individual Contract for SaaS Services of EduTime regarding «EduTime Web-App»

subject.title: Subject
subject.text: Under this contract for the provision of Software-as-a-Service services (hereinafter referred to as "SaaS Individual Contract" or "Contract"), EduTime provides the Customer with the usage rights for standard software (hereinafter also referred to as "Software") for access via a telecommunications connection as well as storage space for the Customer's application data (hereinafter collectively also referred to as "SaaS Service", "Services" or "Web-App") in accordance with the terms of this contract (including its appendices) and the General Terms and Conditions of EduTime for SaaS Services, Version 1.0 (hereinafter referred to as "GTC").

service.title: SaaS Service, Remuneration
service.text1: The Customer receives with this contract for the contract duration the usage rights contained in the following table for the software mentioned therein for use on the server infrastructure of EduTime or the platform provider used by EduTime in the following scope:
service.tableNote: *The remuneration is understood in CHF, plus the applicable statutory VAT.
service.text2: EduTime also provides the Customer with the storage space required for storing the data processed by the software for the duration of this individual contract in the intended scope.
service.availability: The target system availability is 99%, measured monthly on a 7*24 basis. This is a non-binding value that is aimed for by EduTime and its platform provider and is not guaranteed by EduTime.
service.provision: The SaaS Service will be made available no later than 5 working days after the contract comes into effect ("System Availability").
service.organizationNote: [only if contract with an organization: The Customer is entitled to grant persons belonging to their organization access to the SaaS Service within the scope of the licensing ("User"). The Customer must inform the Users about compliance with the provisions in the GTC. The Customer bears sole responsibility for any violations of this contract or the GTC by a User.]
service.text3: Further service components and conditions are agreed in the GTC.
service.payment: The remuneration agreed in the above table is understood as the Customer's fee for the provision of the SaaS Service agreed in accordance with this contract. It is due [monthly/quarterly/annually] in advance with the date of invoicing by EduTime.

duration.title: Contract Duration
duration.text: The initial contract duration is [12] months from the effective date of the contract.
duration.renewal: Thereafter, the contract is automatically renewed in accordance with Clause 14 of the GTC, subject to termination.

components.title: Contract Components
components.text1: The following appendices form an integral part of this contract and apply to it, unless expressly regulated otherwise in this contract:
components.agb: General Terms and Conditions of EduTime for SaaS Service, Version 1.0 of December 20, 2024 (herein referred to as "GTC")
components.avv: [only if contract with an organization: Data Processing Agreement of EduTime, Version 1.0 of December 20, 2024 (referred to as "DPA")]
components.text2: The Customer confirms by signing this contract that they are in possession of the aforementioned components and have taken note of them.
components.text3: In case of contradictions between individual components, these apply in the aforementioned order of precedence.

signatures.title: Signatures
signatures.note: (consent to this SaaS Individual Contract can also be given by email, whereby the signing of this contract can be waived)

Checkout.successDescription: Your license has been purchased successfully. You can now use EduTime.
Checkout.successNote: It may take a few moments for your license to be activated. If it is not activated immediately, please refresh the page.
Checkout.failedDescription: Unfortunately, there was an issue processing your payment. Please try again or use a different payment method.
Checkout.cancelDescription: You have cancelled the payment process. No charges have been made. You can try again at any time.
Checkout.redirectingDescription: You will be redirected to the payment page shortly.
